segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā sāriputto rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto addasa aññatarasmiṃ padese mahantaṃ dārukkhandhaṃ.
segments.en: Then Venerable Sāriputta robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, descended the Vulture’s Peak together with several mendicants. At a certain spot he saw a large tree trunk,

segments.pli: “passatha no, āvuso, tumhe amuṃ mahantaṃ dārukkhandhan”ti?
segments.en: “Reverends, do you see this large tree trunk?”

segments.pli: “Ākaṅkhamāno, āvuso, bhikkhu iddhimā cetovasippatto amuṃ dārukkhandhaṃ pathavītveva adhimucceyya.
segments.en: “If they wanted to, a mendicant with psychic powers who has mastered their mind could determine this tree trunk to be nothing but earth.

segments.pli: Atthi, āvuso, amumhi dārukkhandhe pathavīdhātu, yaṃ nissāya bhikkhu iddhimā cetovasippatto amuṃ dārukkhandhaṃ pathavītveva adhimucceyya.
segments.en: Because the earth element exists in the tree trunk. Relying on that a mendicant with psychic powers could determine it to be nothing but earth.

segments.pli: Ākaṅkhamāno, āvuso, bhikkhu iddhimā cetovasippatto amuṃ dārukkhandhaṃ āpotveva adhimucceyya … pe …
segments.en: If they wanted to, a mendicant with psychic powers who has mastered their mind could determine this tree trunk to be nothing but water. …
Or they could determine it to be nothing but fire …
Or they could determine it to be nothing but air …
Or they could determine it to be nothing but beautiful …
Or they could determine it to be nothing but ugly.

segments.pli: Atthi, āvuso, amumhi dārukkhandhe asubhadhātu, yaṃ nissāya bhikkhu iddhimā cetovasippatto amuṃ dārukkhandhaṃ asubhantveva adhimucceyyā”ti.
segments.en: Because the element of ugliness exists in the tree trunk. Relying on that a mendicant with psychic powers could determine it to be nothing but ugly.”

suttaplex.blurb: Even a simple block of wood can be perceived in different ways by a mendicant with advanced meditation.
